item.title: The Stock Market Isn’t Buying the Bears’ Gloomy Outlook
item.description: The S&P 500 just posted its best May since 1990.

item.title: Deanna Strable’s Journey from Intern to CEO of Principal Financial Group Is Inspiring—but May Become Increasingly Rare
item.description: Insider CEOs slightly outperform outsiders, but many boards value external experiences.

item.title: Why Doesn’t Mark Cuban Dress for Success? Because You Should ‘Beware the Person in the T-shirt’
item.description: ‘Shark Tank’ Shark Robert Herjavec on why the worst-dressed person in the room is often the most powerful.

item.title: Lonely? You Don’t Need an AI Friend, You Need a Book
item.description: Mark Zuckerberg is pushing AI friends as a solution to loneliness, but a better technology already exists—books.

item.title: United Airlines Just Made Me Very Happy That I Put Off Making a Change in My Wallet. It Might Benefit You, Too
item.description: Are there simple things you can do to increase value without costing very much?
